result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher D. Zindars was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (>200-1000g) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)2.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Costs paid in full from cash bond previously posted.  The remaining balance of the cash bond has been applied to companion case of Waushara Co Case No. 2015CF000120.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  Defendant prohibiting from having any contact with Rachel Zindars other than contact that is expressly authorized in the family court actions of Waushara Co Case Nos. 2012FA000097 and 2015FA000045. Contact would be in relation to the children in common and co-parenting issues.

Defendant to undergo a psychological evaluation which is to include a criminogenic risk and need assessment.   No DNA sample ordered as Defendant previously provided the same through another felony conviction.  Should DOC determine sample was not previously provided, upon notification, the Court will modify the JOC and order same to be provided.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

records.addlTxt: 15CF-47 and 15CF-120 - Both Cases Called @ 11:00 AM: Defendant Christopher D. Zindars in court with attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow.  Defendant Christopher D. Zindars in custody.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ruth Zouski, Corporation Counsel also present for the County as to Review Hrgs.  Court has reviewed PSI filed.  Atty Zamzow admits receipt of PSI.  Clarification noted by Atty Zamzow.  Chapter 950 issues in compliance.  Counsel stipulate to 186 days TS credit.  Argument by Atty Blader - will deviate from DOC recommendation.  Argument by Atty Zamzow.  Statement by Def:  None offered. The Court: 15CF-47:  4 yrs term of imprisonment bifurcated as 2 yrs IC/2 yrs ES.  15CF-120 (Fel BJump):    9 mos WCJ - consecutive to 15CF-47 - will extend IC from 24 mos to 33 mos essentially.  Eligible for SAP/Eligible for CIP.  TS credit against 15CF-47 SEH of 186 days - 9 mos WCJ consecutive to 15CF-47 sentence confirmed.  Terms of ES:  AODA and any follow thru;  the defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician; follow thru with any counseling or treatment as deemed appropriate by AODA; undergo psychological eval as to criminal mindset views; no contact with RZ other than as expressly authorized by the family court - contact would be in relation to the children in common and co-parenting issues; Court Costs as to each case plus DNA Surcharge; no sample ordered however if not previously provided Court will order.  Right to expunge DNA record explained thru DOJ.  Bond to be applied - 60 DTP or PP - 25% of inmate earnings to be withheld and applied to costs.  State moves for withdrawal of Motion to Forfeit Bond previously filed - bond will be utilized against financial obligations.  Per Corp Counsel:  As to warrants as to 15JC8 and 15JC9 to allow for participation in programming while at DCI.  Court will withdraw the previously issued warrants as requested.  Appeal Rights Given.
Sentencing hearing on April 21, 2016 at 11:00 am.

9:05 am cases called. 15CF120 & 15CF47. Defendant Christopher D. Zindars in court with attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PSI-Attorney Zamzow has received the report but has not had a chance to go over PSI with her client. Further statement by Attorney Zamzow regarding other pending cases and the defendant may be seeking an alternative PSI-requests extension of time to accomplish resolution. Statement by DA Blader-objects to adjournment and makes a statement regarding request for adjournment. Court makes statement regarding request for adjournment and objection.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 21, 2016 at 11:00 am.

10:33 am case called. 15CF47,15CF120, 15JC8 & 15JC9 case called. Defendant Christopher D. Zindars in court with attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement reached with argued sentence. 15CF120-Court addresses preliminary hearing-Defendant wishes to waive right to preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of right to preliminary hearing. Court has read the complaint, finds probable cause and enters and order binding the defendant over for trial. Information filed. Attorney Zamzow confirms receipt, waives formal reading and enters a plea of No Contest. 15CF47 & 15CF120-  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest to Count 1 of 15CF47 & No Contest to 15CF120. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses and reads-in Counts 2 & 3 of 15CF47. Court questions the defendant regarding a PSI. Attorney Zamzow requests a PSI to be completed. Statement by Court to counsel regarding a PSI. Court orders a PSI to be completed.  Court makes a statement regarding bond.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 12, 2016 at 09:00 am.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Defendant Christopher D. Zindars in court with attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Zamzow states she will be heading to the jail to discuss the offer with the defendant and will let us know regarding a potential hearing for tomorrow. Court sets matter for status in 30 days unless Attorney Zamzow contacts the Clerk of Court's office to put the matter on for P/S on 2/10/16 at 10:30 am.  Status conference scheduled for March 8, 2016 at 10:25 am.

11:55 am case called. 15CF47, 15CF120, 15JC8 & 15JC9. Attorney Jeanne L. Zamzow in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statement by DA Blader-offer has been exchanged however new information has been provided. Counsel requests an additional status.  Status conference scheduled for February 9, 2016 at 09:00 am.

NOT PUT OF RECORD:  15CF-47 et al: Attorney Jeanne L. Zamzow in court, appearing in person.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  STC adjourned as to all matters.  Status conference scheduled for December 3, 2015 at 11:55 am.

records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: 10:03 am case called. 15CF47, 15CF120, 15JC 8 & 15JC9- Defendant Christopher D. Zindars in court with attorney William Michael Lennon.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statement by Attorney Lennon regarding request by defendant to have him withdraw. Court honors request of defendant and grants the withdrawal motion. Court directs defendant to contact SPD for subsequent appointment of counsel. Court questions Ms. Stebbins regarding the post adjudication matters.  Status conference scheduled for November 10, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Defendant appears with Atty Szilagyi by video.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. Defendant not to possess any personal identifying informtion that does not belong to himself or his immediate family. Defendant is prohibited from leaving the State of Wisconsin.

RETURN ON WARRANT: 15CF47 & 15CF129 Cases called @ 1:04 p.m. Defendant Christopher D. Zindars in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 15CF47: Non appearance at hearing July 2, 2015. 15CF129: Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty. Defendant has not yet received a copy of the criminal complaint.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will be represented by SPD. ADA Anderson requesting a $5000 applicable to both matters. Atty Szilagyi requesting the $1000 Cash Bond be reinstated in 15CF47 and the minimal cash bond in 15CF120. Court orders: 15CF120: $5000 Cash Bond - Prohibits the defendant from leaving the State of Wisconsin. 15CF47: The court sets aside the $1000 Cash Bond previously posted pending the motion to forfeit being addressed. $2500 Cash Bond ordered.  IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Initial appearance scheduled for November 3, 2015 at 10:00 am. The court withdraws the warrants in 15JC8 and 15JC9 and will track those cases with the criminal matters.

11:27 am case called. Attorney William Michael Lennon in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court goes over matter on calendar. Statement by Attorney Lennon regarding offer extended and time afforded to defendant regarding offer. Further statement by Attorney Lennon. Statement by Court regarding pending jury trial and contact with Attorney Lennon. Statement by DA Blader. Court questions Attorney Lennon. Statement by Attorney Lennon regarding defendant requesting offer extended and defendant's lack of decision regarding offer. Court authorized the issuance of warrant, without opportunity for voluntary appearance. Further statement by Court regarding warrant. Court cancels Jury Trial currently scheduled for July 22, 2015.

ADDRESS INFO for Christopher D. Zindars
Current: 4840 Village Court #2, Nashotah, WI 53058 United States  (Effective: 06-23-2015)
Prior: 625 Main Street, Redgranite, WI 54970

2:00 pm case called. Defendant Christopher D. Zindars in court with attorney William Michael Lennon.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Matter will proceed to a final pre-trial. Court questions counsel. Statement by Attorney Lennon regarding motion in limine-no issue with motions save the 906.09 motion. Court grants State's motion in limine 1-10 excluding paragraph 8-considering all to be in order and standard. Court addresses 906.09 motion. Statement by DA Blader. Statement by Attorney Lennon. If the defendant elects to testify-answer of 11. If answered in that manner, State will be precluded from asking any other questions, however if untruthful State may proceed with questioning. Court goes over trial management issues. Statement by DA Blader. Notice of statements of defendant at trial and recorded statement of defendant at trial. Witness list from Plaintiff has been supplied. Defense has not provided a witness list and does not believe there will be any defense witness. Statement by Attorney Lennon regarding contact with defendant. State will be willing to continue negotiations. Discussion regarding jurors, etc.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 2, 2015 at 11:45 am.
State's Motion to Impeach with Prior Convictions
Case called @ 3:23 p.m. Defendant Christopher D. Zindars in court with attorney William Michael Lennon.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Lennon is requesting a jury trial.

Case Called @ 1:50 pm: Defendant Christopher D. Zindars in court with attorney William Michael Lennon.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Preliminary Hearing and Time Limits discussed. Defendant wishes to waive preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of preliminary hearing in its entirety.  Complaint describes probable cause as to Ct Nos 1, 2 and 3.  Per DA has discovery available for Atty Lennon today.   Def BOT.  INFO Filed - Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Special Appearance noted and NGP received and entered.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 03:15 pm.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. Defendant not to possess any personal identifying informtion that does not belong to himself or his immediate family.

1:22 pm Defendant Christopher D. Zindars in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Defendant Christopher D. Zindars in custody.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Bond recommendation by DA Blader. Statement by Attorney Szilagyi.   Riverside Ruling in favor of the State finding probable cause as to the three counts in the complaint.  Initial appearance scheduled for March 31, 2015 at 01:45 pm.
